item.title: Simba Updater
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Wizzup?, post:6, topic:364026”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=460258.msg3367743#msg3367743 date=1286931059]

http://git.villavu.com/?p=simba.git;a=blob;f=Extensions/srl.sex

E: Btw keep in mind that Simba actually has an in-built updater. It just only updates when a specific version (larger than the current one) is uploaded and declared stable. ( Uses http://simba.villavu.com/bin/ I manually upload to this)
Mopar builds every X hours regardless whether it is stable or not.

But your Linux builds at least are super-outdated (version 701, current is 750). I wish you would at least just grab mine on the stable builds.
[/quote]

Sounds like a good idea. I’ll do that for 750. Does your system use the git tags?[/quote]

Not as of yet. I’m going to update it to continue to use dates for unstable builds but also have a stable builds directory that uses the tags. I’ll post someplace to let you know when I get around to it.

Read full topic

item.title: Simba Updater
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

[code]program SimbaUpdater;

// A few constants…
const
DownloadUrl=‘http://www.moparisthebest.com/downloads/simba/current/’;
LastUpdateDate=‘2010-Oct-09’;

// This checks for a new version of simba
procedure CheckForNewVersion;
var
url : String;
begin
url := GetPage(DownloadUrl);
if(not(pos(LastUpdateDate, url) = 0))
then
begin
// If the same last update date exists on the page,
// then simba has not been updated
WriteLn(‘Simba is the same ver’);
TerminateScript;
end else
begin
// If it doesn’t, then simba has a new download
// and the download page will be opened
WriteLn(‘Simba has new download’);
OpenWebPage(DownloadUrl);
end;
end;

begin
CheckForNewVersion;
end.[/code]

The script basically checks if there are any changes in the last modified date (which I have to manually log). If there are changes, it will open the page for the person to download. I know that a person can just check the page on his own, but let a script do the job for him!

This is my first attempt at Simba scripting; please provide constructive criticism/tips if need be.

Read full topic
